chapter.title: Super Tuesday
chapter.paragraph: Super Tuesday (January 03rd, 2016) is one of the most important day of the American primaries. People will vote in 13 countries and it could be a decisive moment. “The problem is that candidates have any ideas what to do about fixing housing market.”

chapter.title: Why bother about Mr. Trump?
chapter.paragraph: Donald Trump, known as “The Brick magnate”, is the richest man in America and one of the most controversial personality in the world of politics. He colonized Manhattan and beyond, owning apartments, hotels and casinos. Thanks to this position he could have a big impact on the realty sector if Americans will make him their new president.

section.title: Manhattan
section.subtitle: Where Only A Few Can Live

chapter.title: Manhattan luxury reality market
chapter.paragraph: There is a slowdown: house contracts dropped from 214 (in 2015) to 150 (in 2016). The new trend is to break penthouses into smaller accommodations.

Cuomo (Governor) and De Blasio (Mayor) have different solutions for affordable housing. Cuomo suggests fiscal cuts for $1.5 billion in five years. De Blasio proposes to increase taxes only for whom earn more than $50 millions a year.
